name: COVID-19
description: A global pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus, leading to millions of deaths and major economic, social, and health impacts.

name: Spanish Flu
description: An unusually deadly influenza pandemic, the first of the two pandemics involving H1N1 influenza virus.

name: Black Death
description: One of the most devastating pandemics in human history, resulting in the deaths of millions in Eurasia and North Africa.

name: Third Plague Pandemic
description: A major bubonic plague pandemic originating in China, resulting in millions of deaths globally, especially in India and China.

name: HIV/AIDS pandemic
description: A persistent global pandemic caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) leading to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).

name: Asian Flu
description: An influenza pandemic caused by a new strain of H2N2 virus that began in East Asia and spread globally.

name: Hong Kong Flu
description: A flu pandemic caused by a new strain of H3N2 virus, which killed millions globally.

name: Russian Flu
description: The first true pandemic of the modern era, caused by influenza or perhaps a coronavirus, according to some hypotheses.

name: Antonine Plague
description: A plague of unknown disease that affected the Roman Empire, possibly smallpox or measles.

name: Plague of Justinian
description: A pandemic that affected the Byzantine Empire and Mediterranean ports, considered to be the first recorded occurrence of bubonic plague.
